20220117195013971117.card_body: ### How to make 茶碗蒸し \nChawanmushi, or ちゃわんむし, is a Japanese steamed egg dish. Various versions of the dish can be found across Asia, my mum used to make a version as well which was a family favourite. Chawan in Japanese is a rice bowl or a tea cup, so it's generally made in individual servings. This recipe is good for two large servings or three smaller servings. \n

20220117195126523637.card_body: #### Step 1. \nBreak three eggs in a mixing bowl, then add about the same volume of water. Mix in about a teaspoon of chicken stock powder, stir well.   \n

20220117221728323611.card_body: #### Step 2. \nPour into two individual serve bowls. Works out to be about one and a half eggs per person.

20220117221827906613.card_body: #### Step 3.  \nPut bowls into a large pot with about a centimetre of water at the bottom. Cover and slowly bring water to a light boil. The steam is what will cook the egg, so don't go too crazy. If the water is bubbling you're good to go.

20220117221959673528.card_body: #### Step 4.   \nYou'll know it's done when you can slip in a spoon in the middle and it comes out clean! Turn the heat off, and once cool enough to handle remove from water.

20220117222035544456.card_body: #### Step 5.  \nFinally, heat oil until it's almost smoking, then pour over the egg. Add in just enough soy sauce to cover the top, garnish with some finely chopped spring onions, and serve.

20220117222204769032.card_body:
That's it! Enjoy! 
 
いただきます！

20220118104518656986.card_body: ###### Problem \nGotta find a way to open links in new window.

20220118130535850890.card_body: With Trello, clicking on a new card will open the edit interface, but clicking again will actually only open the card in full screen mode rather than click to change.

20220118144635963666.card_body:
# Drag and Drop past the edge of the viewport   
   
###### Problem    
Probably sorting out this scrolling issue. I suspect having smaller grab target affects scrolling while holding a card somewhat.    
    
###### Answer    
This one isn't really solvable, because the notebook frame is too wide for it to get past because it's too big a landing target. Plus originally the menu was fixed to the right hand edge above the content, but I've redesigned it to go fixed on the left hand edge but *under* the content so it looks as though you're putting your work on top of your desk.     
     
I really love this solution. It puts the users work front and center, but still leaves room for all the menu functions. And it feels genuinely fresh, I've never see an interface quite like this one!

20220118145607881461.card_body: ### List   \nLists are where the brain-dumping happens. It's a quick and loose way of just getting ideas out of your head so you can see them from different perspectives. It's the thinking equivalent of the abacus.

20220118180638636007.card_body: ### Notebook  \n  \nA notebook is where thoughts are reviewed. There's more space to see what you've written, and you can see it together almost like a document.

20220118191232802031.card_body: This one isn't really solvable, because the notebook frame is too wide for it to get past because it's too big a landing target. Plus originally the menu was fixed to the right hand edge above the content, but I've redesigned it to go fixed on the left hand edge but *under* the content so it looks as though you're putting your work on top of your desk.  \n  \nI really love this solution. It puts the users work front and center, but still leaves room for all the menu functions. And it feels genuinely fresh, I've never see an interface quite like this one!

20220118214526309228.card_body: It'd be nice to have a way to collapse / minimise lists so that I can focus on just the ones I want at this moment. \n \nThe counter point is that you can only fit so many lists and cards in view so you can get by by just moving all the ones you don't need off screen.

20220118214716848053.card_body: Access to an archive of some kind. I think this one will be easier to achieve once I move this to a database.

20220118222848712218.card_body:
###### The Archive - Next Steps     
I have to work out what the data format going to the template from @home is so I can build the archive. I should document it too!     
  
###### To-dos:
- Refactor the @home code, break it out into it's own function  
- Make the archive work!  
- Profit! $$$

20220118223608926801.card_body: Colour Tags! Might need to add in some kind of tool bar somewhere. In notebook view the cards can live in the sidebar.

20220118223824334226.card_body: Group cards together. I have no idea how to achieve this yet, but it is a major feature that I really want.

20220118223851948153.card_body: Markdown Export. I want to be able to take a list and export it as one file. Maybe I can merge cards then export? But better to do both. To do one I have to make the other so two birds one stone.
